steps: Chop nira and Tsukemono into small pieces. Once chopped lightly squeeze out some of the water from the tsukemono.
Add all of the other fillings to a bowl and mix well by hand until it's sticky.
Add in chopped chives and tsukemono and mix until evenly mixed.

steps.text: Wrap the gyoza. You can use about 1 tablespoon of the filling for each gyoza.
steps.note: gyoza can be kept on a tray lined with a damp cloth while folding the other gyoza.

steps: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable in a pan, then arrange 16 gyoza in the pan and cook over medium.
Once lightly brown on the bottom, turn the stove up to high heat and pour in about 1/2 cup of water.
When steam starts rising cover the pan with a lid and reduce heat to medium. Steam gyoza like this for about 5 minutes.
Remove the lid and cook until water is fully cooked off.
Flip the gyoza bottom side up on a plate and serve.

notes.title: Dipping Sauce
notes.text: Enjoy the gyoza with Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, and chili oil, mixed to your liking.
